text:
from http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.0/mod/mod_alias.html#redirect

"The new URL should be an absolute URL beginning with a scheme and
hostname, but a URL-path beginning with a slash may also be used, in
which case the scheme and hostname of the current server will be added."

However 
Redirect /foo /foo/
doesn't work, where as
RedirectMatch ^/foo$ /foo/
does

The following seems to be triggered with Redirect and a URL path

http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/httpd/httpd/trunk/modules/mappers/mod_alias.c?view=markup
        if (!use_regex && !ap_is_url(url))
            return "Redirect to non-URL";

Should redirect work with a URL path or not?
creator: stan@saticed.me.uk

text:
Seems to me the documentation is broken.  The code is quite clear about it not
working in the case you report as not working.  Marking this a duplicate of a
request for the feature.
